full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 STANDARD FORM NO. 64 Office Memorandum UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT 1600-54216 TO : OFFICER IN CHARGE, Terminal Island, Calif. DATE: June 25, 1948 FROM : George W. Scallorn, Chief, Entry, Departure and Expulsion Section Los Angeles 13, Calif. SUBJECT: WONG GUCK ON, your file 7402/99. The above-named subject has filed with this office a petition (Form I-133) for the issuance of an immigration visa to his wife, FONG SUEY GEE (Fong Shee), a native and citizen of China presently residing in Sun Loong Village, Tai San, Kwangtung, China. Petitioner alleges that he was born in Sun Loong Village, Tai San, Kwangtung, China, on July 17, 1918, the son of Wong Sick Ho, native-born United States citizen; that his original entry into the United States occurred October 21, 1932, at San Pedro on the SS "President Coolidge" and he was granted certificate of identity No. 67098; that he departed to China in about August 1933 from San Pedro and returned to this country at San Pedro on the SS "President Hoover" on June 12, 1936; that he was married to Fong Suey Gee (Fong Shee) on October 23, 1933, in Sun Loong Village and they have two children. You are requested to furnish this office with a report, in triplicate, showing the facts of record in your office regarding the metitioner's original admission, subsequent departures and reentries, marital status and citizenship. AS RECEIVED JUN 28 1mm. San Pedro, & Naty Calif, Service 1948
